p: S. cerevisiae, the unicellular fungus, is frequently employed as a model organism in scientific research to investigate the mechanisms of various physiological functions within eukaryotic cells and to understand their interactions with the surrounding environment. S. cerevisiae usually are considered non-pathogenic; nevertheless, some information related to S. cerevisiae as one of the emerging pathogens has been published [ 66, 67]. Since the agar disc assay experiments with S. cerevisiae were not successful, mediated amperometry was used as an alternative.
